commitResults.messageTitle: Add scanner to Ui to handle user input
Set JUnit structure for unit testing
Add TodoCommandTest and TaskListTest JUnit Tests
Add Header comments to all classes and some non-private methods
Ensure all codes follow the Coding Standard
Add FindCommand to search for a keyword in task description
Implement Checkstyle-IDEA plugin and fix code style problem
Update build.gradle to set up JavaFX
Use assert feature to document important assumptions
commitResults.messageBody: There are several methods that assumes the inputs to not be null. Using assert feature to safety check these methods improves code quality.

commitResults.messageTitle: Enhance code quality by improving readability
commitResults.messageBody: Parser has conditional statements with complex condition which can be simplified with custom boolean.
Use assert feature to document important assumptions
Enhance code quality by improving readability

commitResults.messageTitle: Parser, Storage: support saving task reminders
commitResults.messageBody:
Tasks in Toki now have reminder details, but these were not
persisted between app runs.

Without persistence, users have to re-enter reminder info
every time the app restarts, which reduces usability.

Let's update the Parser to handle reading/writing reminder fields,
and extend Storage to persist them. This ensures that reminders
are saved and restored consistently with the rest of the task data.

commitResults.messageTitle: docs: add ui.png for user guide
commitResults.messageBody: This image is referenced in the upcoming user guide.

commitResults.messageTitle: docs: add title, intro, and Ui.png screenshot to README
commitResults.messageBody:
The README does not provide an introduction, title, or representative
screenshot of the product.

Adding these elements improves clarity and gives readers immediate
context about the project. The screenshot (docs/Ui.png) provides a
visual reference of the UI, while the title and introduction make the
README more informative and user-friendly.

This sets the foundation for expanding the README into a complete
User Guide.

commitResults.messageTitle: docs: correct Ui.png path on README
commitResults.messageBody:
README contains incorrect path of Ui.png. Image fails to
display on the User Guide Website.

Correct path successfully displays screenshot of the product,
providing visual reference of the UI.

commitResults.messageTitle: release: create release directory that store toki.jar
commitResults.messageBody:
Release directory makes clear indication to users where
the jar. files are located.

commitResults.messageTitle: docs: add Quick Start section and command list to README
commitResults.messageBody:
The README lacked instructions for getting started and a summary of
available commands.

Adding a Quick Start section helps new users set up and run the app
easily. The command list provides a concise reference of features,
improving usability of the User Guide.

commitResults.messageTitle: release: configure fat JAR with Launcher as entry point
commitResults.messageBody:
The build.gradle does not have the correct entry point for
the application. As a result, the packaged JAR cannot be run
directly using `java -jar`.

Let's configure the application and shadowJar plugins to set
`toki.gui.Launcher` as the Main-Class. This ensures the JAR can
be executed directly and launches the app through the Launcher.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add Javadocs for methods on classes
commitResults.messageBody:
Some methods in classes are missing javadoc. Adding Javadocs
can increase readability for these methods, and easily
explain their functionalities to others reading the code
for the first time.

commitResults.messageTitle: Split error handling between Parser and Command classes
commitResults.messageBody:
All error handling logic is concentrated in the Parser,
which mix structural checks (presence/parseability) with semantic
checks (domain invariants).

Let's refactor the design so that:
- Parser validates structural correctness of user input
  (e.g. command format, required tokens, parseable integers/dates).
- Command classes validate domain invariants
  (e.g. non-empty descriptions, start date not after end date,
  valid index range).

This separation clarifies responsibilities, avoids duplication,
and makes commands more robust against misuse outside the Parser.

commitResults.messageTitle: test: add unit tests for EventCommand, TaskList, and MarkCommand
commitResults.messageBody:
Add new test classes to improve coverage:

- EventCommandTest covers happy path, same-day events, blank
  descriptions, and invalid date ranges.
- TaskListTest verifies add/get, delete, mark/unmark, find, remind,
  unremind, and defensive copy behavior.
- MarkCommandTest checks valid marking, non-positive index, and
  out-of-range index handling.

These tests ensure that both command classes and core task list
operations behave correctly under normal and error conditions.
